meanings.definition: In poor condition; shabby or worn out.
meanings.sent1: The mangiest old blanket kept me warm on cold nights.
meanings.sent2: The stray dog had the mangiest fur I had ever seen.
meanings.sent3: Despite its mangiest appearance, the antique chair held sentimental value.
meanings.sent4: The mangiest car in the parking lot looked like it had seen better days.
meanings.sent5: The mangiest teddy bear was still cherished by the child for its history.

meanings.sent1: The mangiest shirt in the store had holes and stains all over.
meanings.sent2: The old house on the corner was the mangiest on the block.
meanings.sent3: Even the mangiest flower in the garden added a touch of color.
meanings.sent4: The mangiest painting in the gallery seemed out of place among the masterpieces.
meanings.sent5: The mangiest toy in the box was always the last to be chosen for playtime.

meanings.definition: Showing signs of neglect or mistreatment.
meanings.sent1: The mangiest cat at the shelter was in need of a loving home.
meanings.sent2: The playground equipment looked mangiest after a long winter without maintenance.
meanings.sent3: The mangiest book on the shelf had pages torn and scribbled on.
meanings.sent4: The mangiest plant in the garden perked up with some extra care.
meanings.sent5: The mangiest stuffed animal in the donation bin still held a child's love.
